bioghist.p: Harry Helson (1898-1977) Born in Chelsea Massachusetts. ... author of many articles, four books... diverse subjects -- color perception, color preference, perception of form, sencory psychophysics, sensory physiology, animal learning, psychology of thought and judgment, ... motivation and attitude chenge and the history of psychology... works focused on adaptation level, perception, history and theory, studies of color, and more... important contributions: critical review of the Gestalt movement (introduced Gestalt psychology to the American psychological community); discovery of the principle of color conversion; exposition of the general theory of adaptation level much more in the way of biographical information is available through JSTOR: Harry Helson: 1898-1977 William Bevan The American Journal of Psychology, Vol. 92, No. 1. (Mar., 1979), pp. 153-160.
